result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Akeisha C McCormick

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Akeisha C McCormick appeared by video.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court for Akeisha C McCormick.  Attorney Katherine Seelow in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Ashley Pashkewitz, City of Milwaukee Police Office.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 41.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court is in trial and unable to hear to this case.  Court will adjourn case.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court is down and unable to hear this case.  Parties emailed new court date.  Defendant appeared by zoom and was given new court date.  Case adjourned, Br 41.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Akeisha C McCormick appeared by video.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz appeared by video for Akeisha C McCormick.  Attorney Elaine Fehrs on behalf of Katherine Seelow appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Order to Show Cause Hearing.  Defense counsel was recently appointed.  Court will set case for preliminary hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Akeisha C McCormick in court.  Attorney Katherine Seelow in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Preliminary Hearing.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel at this time.  Court finds good cause to adjourn time limits and will set case for order to show case hearing.  Public defenders office notified of court date by email.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Order to show cause hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Appointment Status Letter

Defendant Akeisha C McCormick in court in person.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Case adjourned due to SPD not appointing counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch 41, before Judge Skwierawski.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Akeisha C McCormick in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Akeisha C McCormick in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
